  18. Love this product! It works great on my feet. I use raw organic honey on my feet a few times a week and then put organic sugar on them and scrub off all the excess skin wash with castile soap and put on the shea butter after and sleep in socks and my feet are silky smooth! Saving a ton of money in pedicures. It is unrefined so it helps if you melt it and then scoop out any little husks. If the smell bothers you I have had some luck putting a tsp of organic vanilla extract in while it's melting. It seems to help with the nutty smell.

  22. I would like to give this less than 1 star but give amazon.com 10+ stars!<br /><br />So... I ordered this product to make my own skin care for myself at home. I thought it looked a little weird when I got it (not like the picture) but its always hard to see the true color of something when it's in a picture. So I didn't think anything of it. I am also new and still learning on how to make my own skin care products with young living essential oils. Anyway.... I thought I would try the product by itself at first to see how it felt and three consitantcy etc.... So I put it on my face. That night my face felt like I had put fiberglass insulation on my face! It burned and itched! REALLY bad! The next day my face was red and puffy ... Like a bad sunburn. I didn't put any make up on at all.... For about a week! Only the shea butter. The burn kept getting worse! I thought any morning I am going to wake up with my eyes swollen shut! So I called my mom (who is a retired nurse) she told me to get summer aloe (the good kind!) And put it on. So I did.... Nothing but the aloe that night. It finally stopped burning by morning! So I kept using the aloe. I kept thinking &#34;what in the world did I get a chemical burn from&#34; (I had one once before when I discovered I can't use ANY product with retinol in it! ) so I talked with everyone I saw that week about what I could have gotten on my face... Not thinking about the Shea butter! I did not think that could possibly do that! ) and I had put NOTHING on my face except that butter! It kept getting worse! I stopped using it and I am finally healing! So we figured out.... Espcally after reading the reviews here that summer people are getting a good batch of this product and some are not! The color descriptions are different, smell descriptions are different! So.... I apparently got shipped the bad batch! It was slightly gray in color, a little cream to our, but mostly gray. It smelled like clay or something that wasnt awful, but not pleasant, and it was not melting in my hand. It was like wax with a little fine sand in it. Just had an odd, thick texture to it. But apparently the batch I got was REALLY bad since it burned my skin terribly bad! I called amazon on the issue once I figured out it was this product that did this to my face.... And they were MORE than willing to help me! They were very concerned that I was OK and was healing and was not in pain. Then the man I spoke with did summer checking and placed me on hold. While I was on hold he processed a full refund and since I had already moved the product out if the plastic bags and into a large plastic container to keep it air tight.... He told me to just disguard the product. Within min. I received a full refund conformation! Thank you amazon for caring about me and that I was healing and for protecting me and refunding my money! I greatly appreciate it! So.... Now to find a Shea butter that is safe to use and won't be rancid and chemically burn my face! A little nervous to try another one after this!

Once the oils were combined and starting to solidify again, I added in the essential oils and fragrance oils used in each cream. Adding these oils while it is too warm will break down the oils and they will use their purpose. I had no issues with this shea butter and really enjoyed working with it. I did not weigh it when I received it, as I've seen some folks have had an issue with that. The product I received seem to be exactly what it was supposed to be and my customers loved the creams that I created for them.   187. We purchased this five months ago at the same time as the Raw African Black Soap (see our review on that) to hopefully help our daughter who was suffering from severe eczema at the time. As with the soap, this was the latest hoped-for &#34;magic bullet&#34; in our battle with our daughter's eczema.<br /><br />The butter arrived in large ivory chunks in a heavy-duty clear plastic bag. Upon opening it we could smell the oft-mentioned &#34;burnt&#34; smell of the shea nuts. That smell is what it is; we find it neither inviting nor off-putting and you'll have to judge it for yourself.<br /><br />After using it straight from the bag, we took the advice found on several sites about shea butter and broke off a chunk, placed it into a glass bowl, and heated that bowl in a saucepan filled with water until the butter turned liquid. Then we let it cool. As promised, this made the shea butter much softer, easier to apply, and also put the ashes at the bottom.<br /><br />So how did it work? Tremendously well! We cannot say enough good things about shea butter as a moisturizer, both for my daughter's eczema and my wife's dry skin. In terms of the eczema, a light morning application on the eczema areas was enough to keep my daughter's skin moist all day (it normally took two or three applications of Shikai Borage Lotion to achieve the same effect) and a second light evening application did the same while she slept. Furthermore, the moisture built up over time to where we actually needed to use less, going to once a day then once every couple of other days. Did we mention it's noncomedogenic? Yes, it's a really, really good and powerful moisturizer.<br /><br />At this point, thanks to a number of other changes we made (not the least of which was halting all topical steroids - see ITSAN), our daughter's eczema is very mild and we thankfully no longer need to use the shea butter for her. My wife still uses it every couple of days on her face and hands, however, and I also use it on occasion; we still love it and unhesitatingly give it five stars.

  237. Shea Butter is literally life. If you're wondering what color it came as the color I received was ivory. This magic concoction works on everything. Got a pimple, boil, blemish, in grown hair, and other forms of acne? Rub some Shea Butter on it. Now, personally I've used the ivory colored Shea Butter and the yellow colored Shea Butter and both are great! I've heard the the color of the Shea Butter depends on the nut itself and if the nut is roasted for a certain amount of time. But what I've found out is that, to me, the ivory colored Shea Butter works better when clearing pimples (it leaves no acne scars). Use it everyday and you'll start to see the pimple or blemish go down. I use the yellow Shea Butter on by body and the ivory colored Shea Butter on my face. However the yellow (and other colors including this ivory Shea Butter) works fine as lotion, hair moisturizers (for types 3 and 4 hair I don't recommend using it as a moisturizer if you have 1 or type 2 hair), and or chap stick. It'll leave your hair and skin soft and it works to clear up acne. But all in all Shea Butter is good for up keeping appearance especially if the Shea Butter is in its raw state..
  238. I just got this product today and was not surprised at the packaging since I had read all the reviews on Amazon prior to ordering. Packaging wasn't important to me. Further, I knew I wanted to add some essential lavender oil to it to give it a pleasant and calming aroma.<br /><br />I opened the package tonight and emptied the foul-smelling, gooey clump, which was yellow-white with brown specks, into a double boiler and heated it up. I was glad I had a decent-sized bottle of lavender essential oil to freshen it up and get rid of the rancid smell. After melting slowly, I added several drops of lavender and used my electric beater to whip it. It still smelled like rancid oil. I added several more drops of lavender and blended ... still rancid-smelling. After repeating this about six times, adding at least 10-20 drops of lavender oil each time, I became convinced that no amount of lavender was going to mask the rancid smell. I had some natural, strong peppermint oil on hand and tried adding some of it (although this is not something I wished to do) ... still rancid. I added 20 more drops of lavender and another 5-10 drops of peppermint oil, whipping each time. Finally, I gave up with the essential oils and poured the liquid concoction into two containers and set them on the counter to cool. The oil was cool in about 1/2 hour. I put the containers in the refrigerator to harden. Although they've been in the refrigerator for about an hour, they are still liquid. Hopefully, my whipping did not emulsify the batch to the point where I'll have a liquid that will not solidify. If so, my bad.<br /><br />In conclusion, the consistency received was expected, the packaging was expected, however, I did not expect the offensive odor, one that others here have described as \\"not unpleasant;\\" and I especially did not expect my efforts to neutralize the smell with the addition of good, expensive essential oils to be futile.<br /><br />Thus, the reason for my rating of only2 stars should be obvious: I am extremely disappointed with the smell of this product, which, by the way, does NOT seem to fade after skin application.

  247. This product as many people describe comes in a heat sealed plastic bag with not \\"container' so to speak. It smells nutty and earthy, not rancid as others have described. It didn't make sense that a butter (the fat) from a nut smells rancid, considering that I have never experienced rancid coconut paste (pretty much fat solids) from the coconut jelly. The reason I gave this product a 4 in stead of 5 is more so because of my expectation; which i will admit is based on my lack of experience with natural Shea butter and not the seller's fault is how greasy it is on my skin. I didn't really expect from light use a lasting oily feeling to my skin. It is eventually absorbed, but i recommend going with a smaller amount if this is your first order to help you get used to it or determine if you like it,
  248. As countless other reviews have noted, this came in a plastic bag (which I was expecting). The scent is kind of earthy/smoky/nutty, it isn't terrible especially if you are going to be using this in combination with other ingredients to make a body butter or something like it. The things that bothered me most about it... well, as one or two other people mentioned, there were decent sized chunks of the nut/shell left mixed in... this is COMPLETELY unrefined, people. There also were little bits of colorful fabric in mine, no, I'm not kidding. Small but noticeable. Before I use this, I take as much as I need, melt it down in a double boiler, and STRAIN it through some cloth to get out the impurities. I don't think I will be purchasing this particular item in the future, but I might as well use it since I have it.
  249. I liked it but wishes it had come in a tub instead of a bag.

  256. I researched long and hard the different shea butter's on Amazon and this one looked like it might be the best and the cost is reasonable. I have loved this! I use it on my skin as well as on my 2 year old for his eczema. After all the products I've used on him this works the best and I feel the best about it because it's natural and not full of things I don't really want to be using on my 2 year old.<br /><br />Mine came in an un-resealable bag so I needed to find a container for it. The consistency is like hard butter but I just warm it in the palm of my hand and then rub it so it turns into an oil I can rub into the skin. It does not go on well on wet skin - I always make sure our the skin is dried off. It goes on feeling a little heavy or thick but is absorbed into the skin very quickly. It seems to last so much better than other oils or lotions too. I only apply on myself and my son every-other day when I used to have to use other eczema-recommended creams on him twice a day.
  257. I wish I had been using this when I was pregnant! I bought this to treat stretch marks and although I am not claiming it works miracles or even does anything at all to reduce the appearance it does make my skin feel very moisturized and has seemed to help stretch marks (reduction could be due to time...not sure so I won't say it is due to the product). The product comes in a plastic bag and looks somewhat like playdo but with a harder texture. It melts in your hand and makes a smooth grease like product to smooth over skin. I wear a old tank top because it is sticky on the skin and some of the product is left on clothing. The oder is not unpleasant at all. I slathered on Bio-Oil, palmers oil and stretch mark cream, and coca butter while pregnant in an attempt to ward off stretch marks and this raw shea butter is WAY better and a lot cheaper than all those products. I put the product in a old screw cap lotion container and that works beautifully. I would buy this again and again!
  258. Texture wise it's a bit like very firm very dense solid coconut oil. It has a faint but penetrating nutty scent (which I don't mind) but may bother some folks. A lovely light ivory color I didn't notice any residue or staining when I used it but I did allow a fair bit of time for it to soak into my skin and dry before covering the areas it had been applied. I also don't own much clothing that would show a stain from such a light colored substance. It can take some handling to soften enough to apply to skin but is well worth the effort.

  389. I read all of the reviews and took a chance. So glad I did. I expected it to NOT be in a pretty package (based on one of the reviews), and that wasn't my primary criteria anyway. It came in 2 or 3 days, much faster than I expected. Nice nutty smell and it's definitely pure and unrefined. My skin loves it, yours will too.
  390. The product came exactly as I expected it to; a large ivory block sealed in a plastic bag. Upon taking it out, the bag was very messy and my fingers were covered in thick butter. I tried to pack it into a plastic container to use as a body butter later, but I could tell that this was not a one-step process. I looked through a bunch of YouTube videos, and here's what I came up with (so you don't have to):<br />Soft Whipped Body Butter:<br />1. Cut the block into chunks and either stick it in the microwave for a few minutes, or seal the container and soak in hot water until it is melted. Do not let any water get in.<br />2. Pour the raw melted butter into a large mixing bowl. Having a few chunks is normal, but they should be soft.<br />3. Add any mixture of the following ingredients: Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Coconut Oil, Carrot Oil, or any other natural ingredient. That's just what was in my cabinet at the time. I didn't measure, just add what seems about right. (warning: I added a spoonful of Victoria's Secret body butter, and it grossly broke up and settled at the bottom. Do not use.)<br />4. Use a mixer to whip the butter until all of the ingredients are mixed and there are no chunks.<br />5. Pour into desired container. Leave the cap off, and let it solidify.<br />6. Now you should have a soft body butter that melts on your skin. Don't be alarmed if it feels grainy at first contact- this goes away immediately! Not sure why, but I don't mind it. The texture is light and oil-like, and my skin soaks it up like no tomorrow(unlike heavy oils that sit on the skin).<br />Be warned- it smells gross. But within an hour you can't smell a thing. Add your favorite body mist, and you'll look and feel baby-smooth for days. I know I do. Best moisturizer I've ever used, don't hesitate! Four stars for being led to believe it was useable as-is.
  391. Love this. I did not experience any bad smells or any chunks of material. I have very, very dry skin and normally use Egyptian Magic, but their pricing has gotten out of hand, so thought I would try something else. I use it at night before bed and sometimes if I'm just hanging around the house during the day. It is very greasy, but it absorbs within a short amount of time. I put some of it in my old EM jar and the rest in the fridge. It will last a long time.<br /><br />I also have had some hyper pigmentation start over the last couple years on my forehead, neck, and forearms. I actually think this might be helping them to fade. Haven't had a lot of sun yet, so that will be the real test.

  413. Exactly what I wanted. This was 100% pure UNREFINED shea butter,and it arrived in a timely manner in appropriate packaging.<br /><br />For those unfamiliar, this type of shea butter has to be warmed between the hands before applying, as it tends to 'bead' up if applied directly from container to skin. The best way to use shea butter in terms of moisturizing the skin is to whip'it using a blender- this adds air to the shea butter and makes it fluffy and light, aiding in it's absorption. Shea butter has a naturally nutty, earthy, smokey smell. It ranges in color from ivory to a deep yellow.

  488. I expected a high quality shea butter when I saw 100% pure unrefined raw shea butter. After receiving this and making the lotion, I was disappointed and did some research I should have done prior to purchasing it. There are different grades of shea butter as graded by the National Institute of Shea Butter. This shea butter isn't graded. The highest quality shea butter (used for acne, eczema, arthritis and other medicinal purposes) should be ivory and the consistency of mildly soft butter. This shea butter, unlike the photo, is a yellow color (which I learned is dyed using plant dyes) and is a harder consistency and has an off odor. It still works as a moisturizer, but not for the medicinal benefits I was anticipating. I then purchased a grade A shea butter from SoulShea and the difference between the two in appearance, consistency and odor is night and day as well as the stark difference in the medicinal benefits I am experiencing that I didn't get with this shea butter. If you are simply looking for a moisturizer...go for it....if you want a high quality shea butter that gives you the healing power of shea...skip this one!

I live in Utah and what makes the &#34;greatest snow on earth&#34; is our incredibly dry weather, well below average humidity. The dry air is disastrous for skin, hair and nails. I use this shea butter every other day. I rub it vigorously between my palms to melt it then apply sparingly to my body and rub in while giving myself a massage, what a treat. My nails had horrible ridges in them, those are gone now, my cuticles look great and it's wonderful dabbed under the eyes. It also got rid of my husband's horrible calluses on his heels and feet. Amazing stuff, worth every penny. The quantity will probably last us a year & is far more effective than any store bought lotion I've ever tried. It does make your skin a bit sticky for a while after you've applied it so if you try to put on snug clothing it might be a struggle. Throw on something light, within a couple of house the shea butter will have absorbed completely leaving your skin glowing beautifully.

  512. I couldn't believe how much of this shea butter you get, especially when some companies are selling cute little 2 ounce jars of this for $12.00. Great product. You can do a lot of different things with it; including adding your own essential oils to it, or coconut oil (adding this with shea butter helps mixture absorb a little faster). It doesn't make my body breakout, like pretty much 90% of the products that I have tried in the past. Its a little oily when you first apply I usually try to wear minimum clothing and let it absorb naturally. It does absorb in skin after a couple hours. Some times I just wear a robe or towel for awhile. I think a little of the shea butter does rub off on whatever I am wearing; not a good idea to apply before you put on your best clothing but once absorbed its fine. The best way to apply is when you first get out of shower/bath. The next morning after I have applied the shea butter my skin is super soft. I sometimes use it on my face and I don't break out; but once again it is very oily and if my hair touches face it makes my hair greasy.<br />It is useful as a hand lotion and works better than almost everything I have tried in the past (none of them natural products). It is unlike some products that go on soft, but then later make hands feel even more dry. I also apply on my lips, under my eyes, and most recently started using as a deodorant with essential oils mixed in.
  513. I live this Shea butter I use it to moisturizer myself and toddler. Initially, I purchased this Shea butter to use on post surgical scars. In 5 months my scars have improved dramatically.   563. So far, I have purchased three one-pound packages of this shea butter, and followed the recipe shown in the first review. The finished product, all three times, has smelled pretty strong, and essential oils as a strong as lavender and lemongrass have not covered the smell up. I have used probably 100 drops each time, and cannot tell a difference between batches, even though in one batch, I used frankincense, myrrh, and sandalwood, in another batch only lemongrass, and in a third batch, I used lavender, lemongrass, blood orange, and a bit of spearmint. All the batches smell essentially the same.<br /><br />The supplier was Halaleveryday. I contacted them with my concerns. It is not possible, to my knowledge, to contact the manufacturer, because that would be some tribe in Africa. Halaleveryday responded to my email quickly in a polite, straight-forward way, causing me to have confidence in them. Also, I am the only person so far in my circle of friends and family that has found the smell of this shea offensive and overpowering. He said their turnover is about 21 days after shipment is received, so from their end, the turnover is quick.<br /><br />For the past several days, I have even been using it on my hair. I am a Caucasian woman. In this instance, it seems important to mention, because after reading many reviews, it became apparent that shea butter is used by many African Americans before styling their hair, and it doesn't sound like it is washed out. So it sounded good to try this with my own thin hair, except that the shea would have to be shampooed out after application. It has worked marvelously. I get in the shower and suds up all over. then apply the shea butter all over, starting with my hair and moving to face, neck, trunk, arms, legs and feet. By this time, the shea butter has been sitting in my hair for about 5 minutes, maybe a little longer, and I shampoo it out. Then I pat dry and leave the shower without any greasy feeling anywhere. Less than a week of doing this has changed my hair and skin in very good ways.<br /><br />I will continue to buy shea butter from Halaleveryday.ess than a week of doing this has changed my hair and skin in very good ways.<br /><br />I will continue to buy shea butter from Halaleveryday.

I then scoop out what I need for each application with a small spatula, keeping the shea butter clean from dipping with fingers and making it easier to get just the right amount out of the jar.<br /><br />It is VERY thick and I find by adding a few drops of Jojoba oil to a bit of shea butter in my palm, rubbing my palms together to warm the shea butter and mix the shea with the oil, creates the perfect cream for keeping soft throughout the dry summer.

This year's product was off-white in color, nearly odorless and came in a plastic bag. At first I was concerned because it seemed too light to be a full pound, but I weighed it and it was actually one ounce heavier. It worked beautifully in my recipe and I will not hesitate to order again.<br /><br />As far as I can tell, I have received exactly what the description offers: 1 lb of pure unrefined shea butter. I gave 4 stars rather than 5 for the wide variation in quality, but overall I am very pleased and feel comfortable recommending this product.

I love it! You know when you have 100% shea butter when its applied to the skin its effective & absorbs quickly . You don't need much with unrefined shea butter either a little bit does go a long way, if you feel or look to greasy afterwards its because you used way to much. I was able to easily whip my shea butter & fill a 16 ounce jar of it alone & a 4 oz jar mixed w/ coconut oil, castor oil, olive oil & grapeseed . The picture is very misleading, this is the same shea butter you can get at any beauty supply store for less than $10.00! Don't waste your money. Authentic shea butter is ivory and not yellow the yellow comes from the dye the manufacturer puts in it, but the actual nut from the Shea tree is ivory inside. Please don't waste your money.

  823. First off, I'm tired of seeing bad reviews based off packaging. I think a PRODUCT review should reflect the product itself and its quality. If you don't like the packaging, thats where the SELLER Reviews come in! With that being said, I have no problem with the package which was in a sealed plastic bag. I simply transferred the block to a couple of pyrex containers. The product was one solid mass of great shea butter. Now, the butter is slightly grainy in texture but even the smallest grains will melt upon contact with skin. RAW shea butter will be grainy and ivory colored and smell slightly nutty. The smell goes away but I dont notice the smell anyway. It is working well for my troublesome skin. I havent been able to keep my eczema completely gone because my diet is so incredibly awful (sugar addiction, dont judge me lol) but I have been able to replace my itch relief lotion with this one. Not only does it keep away the itch from my flare-ups but my skin is much softer and seems to retain moisture better thus I don't have to reapply as often as I did with regular lotion. Skin stays hydrated which has always been an issue for me. I typically have ashy knees 24/7. I use this on my face as well but it tends to be a little greasy but the trick is to apply to face, then take a warm wash cloth or papertowel and wipe down your face. It removes the excess but leaves just enough on your face to moisturize and benefit from the goodies in the shea butter.

  871. I am new to natural organic products. I have a daughter with very beautiful natural hair, but also very dry, and since then I have been looking for only natural and organic items. During my trials and errors I am now becoming an all organic household, I have two boys also. So I am now with the saying \\"if you can't eat it, then it shouldn't go on your body\\" Which lead me to making my own products so I know what exactly is in it. I purchased my first shea butter at a health food store, I thought that was really good until I read an articel saying that one should purchase the unrefined. So I did, and reading all of the reviews I was quite skepticle in buying this one. Well I have prime so I got this in two days and yes it comes in a plastic bag but it is air sealed and since it is the fall it was not melted and I absolutely love it. I cut open the bag with scissors, cut up the two blocks in half and put it in a tubaware plastic container. The color is biege, with a yellow tint and I was almost dissapointed cause I thought it was the yellow butter. But once I melted it down and mixed in coconut oil, lavendar, jojoba and vitamin e, it came out as an off white color, just like you may see it on you tube. And comparing it to the one I bought at the health food store I can tell the difference in smell and texture. The one I bought in the store was much oily than this one, and the smell isn't as pronounced. You can tell with this one that it came straight from the earth to my door step:) I really like it and will order it again. I didn't give it 5 stars just because I never give anything 5 stars, that's just the way I am. Nothing really blows my mind.   874. Quite a good price for the amount that was purchased, will last quite some time. It comes in a double sealed plastic bag. I scooped it all out and put it into a glass jar with a secured rubber seal. Keep in mind that quite a bit gets stuck to the plastic so I cut the plastic into small squares to smear it on the areas of my body before attending to the jar.<br /><br />The odor is quite strange, although I've gotten quite used to it. The smell is not that strong after application, only a faint scent. The butter is hard, but it starts to soften up after rolling it in between my index and thumb fingers for 30 seconds or so. Application is easy, rubbing it into the skin for a minute or so. Keep in mind that it will not fully soak into the skin no matter how long you rub it, so I let it soak in for the rest of the day, skin stays oily for quite some time. Don't fear it staining your cloths, none of my shirts nor pants have left any stains.(All colors)<br /><br />I bought this in the hopes of decreasing the visibility of my stretch marks that I got from some gain weight over the past few years (they are old stretch marks).<br /><br />I first read about shea butter online, so I followed by going to my local grocery store and purchasing a typical lotion with shea butter. What is not told is among all the ingredients in the lotion, there is typically only 2 teaspoons at most in it. Now who knows if it is refined/altered, most likely. You will never get as close to pure unrefined shea butter as this one and other sold here on amazon I presume.<br /><br />I have been applying the butter for 3 days now, and so far, WOW. It's quite amazing, completely moistens the skin like a baby's bottom. Although the stretch marks aren't gone and I don't believe they ever will be, so far it has decreased the visibility quite a bit for only a few days of use. My biggest stretch mark has a odd red mark in the middle of it, quite visible. That started to lighten a considerable amount after thefirst day, 3 days later even more!<br /><br />All I can say is try it, for whatever reason you need it for. Product is amazing, price is quite reasonable!

  893. This is my first purchase of raw shea butter, and I'm very pleased. I usually purchase my shea butter already whipped, and packaged in the tub. It was sent in a plastic bag, and cold from the weather conditions here. I allowed it to sit out for a few days before transferring it to an old tub previously used for shea butter. Not only did I get more for my money, but the lack of &#34;whipping&#34; did not take away from the creaminess of the butter. The texture is obviously different, but it still rapidly dissolves/melts in your hands which is fine by me!!!
  894. This is the first time I've ordered Shea Butter it looks nothing like the picture which was the basis of my purchase. What I got was bright yellow but I had read several articles referencing yellow as a possible color for shea so I wanted to try it out. It came in a tub about 1/4 inch on top was greyish muted yellow I scrapped that off and melted the rest down mixing with my coco butter. After it cooled it still was very bright yellow and it does leave a hint of yellow on my skin, that's a sign of being colored right? Sorry, I don't think I'll order from here again the picture they use is very deceptive not a good practice for business in my book. Would be appreciative to knowing where the good shea at a reasonable price is. Thank you

The results: I wasn't able to smoothly apply the shea butter as a lotion, as it's more of a solid than a liquid. Yet after blending it with oil (avocado, although I'm sure olive oil or vitamin E oil would also work fine), coconut oil and a little bit of heavy cream, I was able to apply it as a body lotion and / or facial crÃ¨me. By adding baking soda to the mix, I found I could use this combination of ingredients as a highly-effective crÃ¨me-like deodorant, as well. I only made a small quantity, since I wasn't sure how quickly that combination of ingredients would expire. I think the texture of the shea butter would make a good solidifying ingredient for stick-like, smear-on homemade deodorant.

  944. I had purchased unrefined shea butter from other sources and really liked the product, but I wanted to compare prices from various sources to see if I could find a better deal. When I came across the shea butter from Skin Beauty Solutions, I was thrilled by the low price. Suspecting this was too good to be true, I read through the reviews, and ultimately decided to try it. I didn't care that it came in a plastic bag. When the product arrived, my suspicions proved to be true. The shea butter was darker than the unrefined shea butter I had purchased previously from another source. That was the first tip off. When I melted it down to use in my lotion [I use a hot water bath, not direct heat], it went from a dark solid to a dark liquid, the color of amber. I discovered foreign material, some was floating around in the liquid butter and some had settled to the bottom of the container. The foreign material consisted of small dark specks, tiny fuzzy bits of material [it's anybody's guess what it really was], and what looked like parts of insect wings. I wanted to salvage it so I poured the melted shea butter through several layers of cheesecloth to strain out as much of the foreign material as I could, but it didn't improve the color. I've learned my lesson here. You get what you pay for. You pay a ridiculously low price and you get an inferior product. Needless to say, I won't be purchasing this product from Skin Beauty Solutions again.

So not only are you wasting product, you are potentially damaging anything else in the box. Several people have mentioned this so I'm surprised they haven't modified their packaging for shipment. All it would take is placing the tub in a ziplock bag to ensure it doesn't leak. I'll order it again, but not during the summer.

  1028. I thought I would make a video review, and maybe I'll get to that later, but for now I'll just review and tell you how to make your own Shea Butter.<br /><br />Like everyone else said, it comes double bagged so the packaging isn't the best. However, mine was sealed well and not damaged and I was perfectly fine with it. It was true ivory Shea, which generally means pure. It wasn't rancid or anything like that either. That smell is what it should smell like if not refined and without additives.<br /><br />Overall, the quality was very high and quite a bargain when you consider that most products that say they are Shea based contain only a spoon full or two per container in reality. This allows a much higher level of purity for anything you'd like to Shea up. Very pleased with it and I do plan to re-order. I'll be making home made shea butter in custom scents for everyone for Christmas this year!<br /><br />That said, it can be a bit difficult to use and does leave a smell when you don't doctor it up. So I do. Here is the easiest way to do it for you too.<br /><br />To Make Shea Butter:<br />1) Very slowly melt your shea in a double boiler OR by floating a bowl containing the shea in a large pot. Use very low heat since it melts at body temperature. The more heat, the more vitamins you take out of it so less is better.<br /><br />2) Once mostly melted (you can leave some chunks), you can let it settle some to be sure there are no sediments (also normal for unrefined though mine had none) and then pour the liquid carefully into another bowl for mixing, leaving the sediments behind.<br /><br />3) Add about 5 ounces of various oils to one pound of Shea. I added 2 ounces of Sweet Almond Oil, 2 ounces of Hazelnut Oil and 1/2 ounce of Wheat Germ Oil and Macadamia Nut Oil each.<br /><br />4) Mix using a hand mixer (not your kitchen aid) on whip for a long time. To shorten the time, just mix it enough to fully incorporate the oils (maybe 2 minutes) and then put the bowl into the fridge for 10 minutes. It will form a white layer on top of cooled shea. Then you take it out and keep mixing. It will take so long that you'll think you're doing it wrong, but you're not. Just keep going. Eventually, you'll start forming something that looks like frosting that smells a lot better than plain Shea.<br /><br />5) Add your scent oils. I use pure essential oils and I made 2 batches. One Rosemary Mint and one Lavendar Orange. Both lovely. You'll need to decide your own amounts on this but you don't need a whole lot of it. Then mix it in and voila, you're done. Spoon into whatever containers you'd like to use. I used pyrex bowls with the plastic lids.<br /><br />6) Makes about 5 pints. It will re-stiffen, but not as much as before, and will spread and melt more easily. Also soaks in a tad faster.he fridge for 10 minutes. It will form a white layer on top of cooled shea. Then you take it out and keep mixing. It will take so long that you'll think you're doing it wrong, but you're not. Just keep going. Eventually, you'll start forming something that looks like frosting that smells a lot better than plain Shea.<br /><br />5) Add your scent oils. I use pure essential oils and I made 2 batches. One Rosemary Mint and one Lavendar Orange. Both lovely. You'll need to decide your own amounts on this but you don't need a whole lot of it. Then mix it in and voila, you're done. Spoon into whatever containers you'd like to use. I used pyrex bowls with the plastic lids.<br /><br />6) Makes about 5 pints. It will re-stiffen, but not as much as before, and will spread and melt more easily. Also soaks in a tad faster.

  1031. As mentioned by others, this comes in a plastic bag - heat sealed. As long as you dont live in a place where ambient temperature is above 35 Celcius/ 95 Farenheit it is fine as it'll be a solid ivory colored cake below this temp. The product is not rancid if you smell mild nut-like smell. This is almost same smell you would get if you try unscented &#34;Everyday Shea&#34; but without any base q.s organic chemicals. Refrigerate the product as soon as you get it to prolong shelf life, melt it using indirect heat ( utensil heated with hot water). Add your favorite aromatic essential oil for daytime using. You wont notice smell withing few minutes of application on skin.<br />I will not explain all the benefits about shea here. There are many sites/pages doing it.

  1047. This is a pound of shea butter just barely milked from the tree: when you get it, it's a lump of gray stuff with gritty bits in - nutshell pieces. Therefore, I suggest melting it over low heat and straining it before you do anything else.<br /><br />And tasting it. It's edible, but doesn't taste like dairy butter. It has an earthy flavor and a texture so lascivious it ought to be arrested. It feels like silk in the mouth. I'm definitely going to try using a tiny bit of this to make a roux with.<br /><br />When you apply it to your skin you may think you've left some of the grit in, but these are small particles of the butter than do not melt into your skin quite as readily as the rest. Just rub the butter in, and in 5 minutes the particles will have dissolved. They'll be softening your skin.<br /><br />I have very dry cuticles in winter. I took a cup of the butter while it was still liquid and stirred 4 capsules of dry vitamins [[ASIN:B003TTTRDA Bariatric Advantage Dry Vitamin A 10,000 IU]] and [[ASIN:B003TTTKA0 Bariatric Advantage Dry Vitamin D 5000 IU - 60 ct]] into it. This I use for handcream; could also use for diaper cream if you added [[ASIN:B003IGOL8U Zinc Oxide Powder - 1 lb. in Quality Heat Sealed Resealable Zip Lock Pouch]].<br /><br />All by itself the butter has softened my dry heels remarkably in just 3 days. And my face loooves it. It's incredibly moisturizing without being at all greasy.<br /><br />So I can't say enough positive things about this shea butter. If you're thinking of using it to keep a leather drumhead supple, be my guest! It'll work for that too. After all, skin is skin.

If you go on the nda's website they tell you the different types including if it is refined or organic. Please do your research before you decide to send it back.

  1174. ***Update December 2014***<br /><br />Wanted to update my review simply to say that I've recently found some new ways to use this stuff, and I feel it's my duty to pass it along since it has helped me so much. From my original review, you know my skin is the WORST, so I get excited when something affordable actually works! First, you can cook it down in a double boiler, and pour it directly into empty lip-balm containers, and never buy Chap-Stik again! (which dries your lips anyway) Amazon sells the containers for cheap. Second...you can melt it down with some coconut oil and whip it up with your blender to make some killer 100% natural body butter (Thank You Pinterest). Third...you can make natural soap with it and take it into the shower (not as hard as it sounds). Fourth...melt it down and add it to a cup of white sugar for the best moisturizing sugar scrub you've ever used in your life (also-Pinterest). I've also made a coffee scrub with it. That's it! Good luck, hope that helps somebody!<br /><br />***8/9/12 Review***<br /><br />My skin is well, kinda yucky. I suffer from combination skin and large pores on my face, dry scaly/bumpy skin on my body (super-prone to razor bumps and rashes-gross!)...and to top it off, hereditary stretch marks! Never had any children, but I have them anyway! I started getting them when I was 11 years old after a quick growth spurt on my arms, legs...pretty much everywhere. Needless to say I've led a covered up, self conscious existence. I hate declaring my flaws like this, but this is a public service, right? When I was in high-school, I discovered tanning which really helped me with smoothing out my skin and minimizing these issues (yay SUN!).<br /><br />Recently however, my Father has developed skin cancer since taking up golfing in his retirement (boo CANCER!), and it has freaked out my sister and I so we've BOTH stopped with the tanning...really, what a horrible thing to do anyway...but when you find something that works...you sometimes mindlessly just do it.<br /><br />So if somebody tells me this Shea Butter stuff causes cancer, I'm just going to become a hermit because I gotta tell you...IT WORKS! I mean, almost IMMEDIATELY, I started to notice it attacking the issues on my skin. When you rub it in, the first thing you notice is, it stinks. It smells like a health food store. So, plan on spritzing something else on over it! But don't however buy the \\"Golden\\" shea butter, while it DOES moisturize...it's not pure, so it doesn't have the healing qualities. You'll also notice it's chunky and a little hard to work with, so you have to palm it, and work it a bit to get it to a point where it will apply to your skin.<br /><br />THEN you must rub....and rub, and then rub some more. Massage those troubled areas (for me, that's everywhere)! Get the blood flowing, and get that stuff worked in as much as possible. You'll never get it all the way DRY, that's just how it is, it's going to bead water--it's butter. But it's not an oily thing, it won't stain your clothes. Then sit back and let it do it's thing.<br /><br />Whatever that is, I don't know the science! To me it's just awesome! In a little under 1 week, I noticed the skin inside some of my stretch marks start to soften, and the backs of my arms get SMOOTH, shaving got easier too.<br /><br />The craziest thing though was, I had a giant gash on my leg where I'd fallen off my bike...and in 2 days this stuff healed more of the tissue than over 1 month of Neosporin...and that is the God's Honest Truth. I am NOT a health-nut, Noni-juice, copper-bracelet-type person at ALL...these are cold, hard factual observations by an EXTREMELY AVERAGE 33-YEAR-OLD GIRL from Detroit-ish Michigan. :)<br /><br />You're going to start noticing too, just how MANY products out there have shea butter in them...and then go ahead and throw some petroleum-based fillers in them (which actually DRY-OUT your skin & lips), and how much money you've wasted over the years! Sogo do your duty and spread the word to your friends & family now that you KNOW the truth!!go do your duty and spread the word to your friends & family now that you KNOW the truth!!

It's not particularly difficult to deal with as I rub it between my hands until most of them are melted anyway. But if you're mixing it for sale or need a super smooth texture, order during colder months.

I have purchased this exact same product but by a different seller, Halaleverday. The product I received from Halaeverday was was ivory, in large chunks, and in a two plastic bags. However, it worked fantastic. I stored it in the refrigerator and have used it to make whipped shea butter for my hair and body. The previous seller, lakesidemall, should not have sold their item with the label 100% Pure unrefined raw shea butter. Amazon receives items from different suppliers, so if you are interested in this particular product I would suggest you investigate the supplier. Amazon customer service is great and provided me with a full refund!

  1224. I have systemic Lupus and Lupus destroys the collagen in your body. It is a pain-in-the-behind to soften and apply but heating a small amount in the microwave speeds up the process. You should apply this at night as it takes about an hour to totally absorb into the skin. It really has no odor but if it bothers you, add a few drops of coconut oil, which, by the way, also makes it a little easier to apply.<br /><br />Following a vigorous exfoliation (this is an important first step to remove dead skin cells) apply the shea and massage, massage, massage. If you are religious about applying this at least every other day, you will see amazing results in a couple of weeks. My skin has become soft and supple with no razor bumps and no dry patches. It also has worked well on my feet after I use Flexitol (also a TERRIFIC product)and a Ped Egg.<br /><br />You can certainly pay a lot more for skin cream but believe me, you won't find anything that works as well as this. I actually do not mind this as it has been stated on many sites that this type of shea actually contains more nutrients then its white counterparts. It has a nutty scent that is light and smelled the same as other sheas I have had in the past. This shea is an excellent moisturizer and I use it in my 3chair on my face and body. I also use it in both of my daughters hair. One has 4b hair and the other 3c hair. This brings out the natural curls and textures beautifully as well as detangles and moisturises. My daughter doesn't like the smell, I love it, and my boyfriend says it doesn't bother him, but he doesn't love it like I do. I recommend finding someone who sells raw, unscented Shea Butter (if you can) and give it a sniff before you buy a pound of it. It comes in a heat-sealed bag, so have a jar ready. I mush it up in the bag to get it soft and pliable, then cut off a corner and squeeze it into a wide-mouthed jar. It fills one large mayonnaise jar quite nicely. Kept in a cool place, it seems to stay soft and usable for as long as it lasts around here. I don't do anything more to it, but the preparations listed by other reviewers sound good, too.
  1269. **Stars are for the product only. Packaging presentation would have been a 1**<br />First of all...its Shea Butter! My WHOLE family loves this stuff and I probably have a lot to do with it. Somehow it looked cheap and poor quality and I thought I should check it for bugs and debris. If I had purchased it at a farmers that would have been fine but when it is being shipped across the country w/other items the packaging needs should be more durable for lack of a better word. If it had been as hot as it is now in Vegas where I live when it arrived it would have melted in the box and ruined everything as it sat on my doorstep. Although it was annoying, in the end it was not a big deal, I transferred it to a plastic container I had and sat it in some warm water to soften it and melt it down to fit the shape of the container. So you may want/need to transfer it to a different container to make it easier to use on a regular basis.

  1307. I have purchased Shea Butter from another vendor on Amazon. That product was more yellow. This vendor's butter is more of an off white or cream color. The other vendor's butter was decent. However, there is a considerable increase in quality with this unrefined Shea Butter. I noticed that this butter is much softer and easier to work into the skin and spreads farther. The effects of the Shea Butter are also much more noticeable. I like Shea butter because it alleviates a rather sever and persistent dry skin condition. Shipping was fine. I was not surprised by the elementary, some might say primitive packaging, because I had read other reviews. As long as the vendor supplies me with fresh Shea butter that smells fresh as this last batch, I will buy again.

  1417. Unrefined shea butter is usually yellow.... it is when it is refined n much like cocoa butter has been bleached or chemically treated to REMOVE the color that it then becomes white. Several natural oils and butters have yellow color because many are derived from nuts etc... which are NOT white... that is the more natural form. Cocoa butter, comes from the cocoa bean, when cocoa liquer is extracted you can then process the fats for said butters. Because some don't want a mild chocolate smell it is further refined n bleached etc to remove color.<br />Shea butter comes from the shea nut.... the remaining butter is yellow.<br />Milk is white but when churned and curds separated the fats or butter is light yellow...<br />Goes to reason more natural product that has been less refined would remain more pigmented...<br />Shea has a distinct smell, but if stored properly and truly organic doesn't really \\"go bad\\". Should not smell rancid, but for a pleasant smelling shea experience usually there are other essential oil scents mixed In.<br />Shame on a seller that taints the name of such a usually wonderful product.
  1418. Next time I will buy a mo.re expensive Shea butter because this one has tiny hard pieces in it. I use it to make my own lotion mix, so have a bad batch due to the hard pieces of Shea butter.
  1419. I used this in sunblock my girls and I made. It smells really good (I didn't use essential oil so it came out smelling like this butter) and absorbs well.
  1420. This stuff is AWESOME !! Will buy more in the future . . .
  1421. This is the same stuff you can buy at whole foods for twice as much money. I have not noticed a difference in the quality vs. more expensive unrefined shea butter. I did not bother melting it down - it liquifies enough when I rub it between my hands. It does have a mild scent but it's not bad or strong. It literally is just a chunk of shea butter in a bag, so there's no packaging if that's important to you.
  1422. This butter is yellow. Not ivory like unrefined raw shea butter should be. Please do not have ivory shea butter pictured if that is not what you are selling.

  1561. I love it. It is perfect. The quality is 100% perfect. Reviews about the smell and texture are from people who have never had raw, unrefined shea butter. A smooth, scentless butter is a sign that you are receiving a processed butter- and that is a butter who's potential for healing has been diminished by 70-80% through the processing.<br />This butter can be worked into products, but it takes a little work to get it the proper texture without processing or overheating it. I've successfully made a smooth product whose texture is identical to crocker butter, for example. It just takes practice and experimenting.
  1562. I love the Shea butter! That's exactly what I was looking for! Great smell and it makes my skin so soft.
  1563. Let me start of by saying I absolutely love organic unrefined shea butter!! it's one of the most moisturizing and delicious natural oils that you can put on your body and can heal most skin allergies and irritations all on its own. I also waited to write this review until I was able to order a USDA certified organic, raw, unrefined shea butter from Mountainroseherbs.com to compare it with this product in order to be fair.<br /><br />I received this product in a thin plastic container with a lid (looked like potato salad that you would order from your local deli), not in a plastic bag as others mentioned. The faded label on the container said, \\"sold as set...ready to ship\\" with a bar code on it. There is no organic certification printed anywhere on this product or ingredients - it definitely not USDA organic. I used quite a bit of the pound that i purchased. Yes, it did have a strong smell like shea butter, but this one was more pungent and bitter as if it was on the cusp of going bad (Pure, unrefined organic shea butter is a yellow/beige color and their is a a nutty somewhat earthy odor that I am used to. Some like it and some don't. I don't love the smell, but I wouldn't use shea butter in any other way, most of the healing properties are destroyed during the refining and bleaching process as is the smell, which is why cosmetics and skin care manufacturers buy it refined - because it eliminates the odor and will last longer.....adding organic essential oils to organic unrefined shea butter can make it smell wonderful - but if your shea butter is white and smells fresh and clean, than it has been been refined and bleached). I noticed immediately that this shea butter had lumps that seemed more greasy than the non-lump areas if that makes any sense - it had a distinct heavy emollient feel to it. I must admit that it did feel good on my skin, I have dry, sensitive and problematic skin, so I like a thick and hardy cream. I still had an open mind, in fact I referred it to my Mom who bought it as well, plus i read all of the great reviews and the fact that it comes all the way from Ghana......hmmmmm, .<br /><br />Well, I used it to make several lotion, cream, lip balm and healing butter recipes that require melting down shea butter along with beeswax and other carrier oils in a double boiler. It took longer to melt down the shea butter than it did the beeswax...more than 20 minutes....that was not a good sign. So, I stopped using it and ordered a pound of shea butter from mountain rose herbs as mentioned above to see how the two products compared. The quality, consistency and appearance were truly a night and day difference. The new shea butter was smoother, almost flaky - although thick, it was not chunky. Additionally, it did not have a heavy feel to it - once you applied it to your skin it melted right in with a slightly thinner consistency. The smell was definitely reminiscent of shea butter, as it should be and when I used it to make the products above, it melted quickly!<br /><br />I did see the review where someone mentioned there was petroleum jelly mixed in this product. I have not tested this product nor will i volunteer to so given the expense, but it felt to me like it was possible something else was mixed in.<br /><br />I would love to hear what the seller has to say about this shea butter as I have not yet seen a singe response to any of the reviews. I would also urge the seller to be careful when labeling this product as \\"organic\\" and selling it that way when it is clearly not certified.<br /><br />I will not buy this product again. If you are looking for a natural organic pure and urefined shea butter, this product is not what it claims to be - buyer beware!
  1564. This was my first time making my own sgea butter hair moisturizer. This stuff was delivered in a timely manner and it was very moisturizing. I also use it on my skin. Im pleased with it and I will buy it again
  1565. I will definitely purchase this particular product again. It came quickly, which I love. Thanks!!
  1566. Arrived quick, great product.
  1567. Doesn't smell as good as maybe the processed stuff. I don't know. Still haven't tried it for any skin conditions.
  1568. When I purchased this shea butter back in January (2013) it was $4.50. Now when I decide to purchase some more the price has jumped to $10.00! Are you kidding me? Why did this happen? I guess I will have to find somewhere else to buy my shea butter from now on because I refuse to pay $10.00 for this!<br /><br />But on a positive note,I loved this shea butter. I would whip mines and add oils (cocnut oil,olive oil,etc.) to it until I got the consistency I wanted. I used this on my body and hair,and it makes my hair very soft and moisturized.<br /><br />It would have gotten 5 stars instead of 4 if it wasn't for the increase in price.
  1569. this stuff is great. you can just cut a chunk off and rub it into your skin and it melts. I will say if you DO NOT use LOW heat it will become grainy, or gritty. I use it in sugar scrubs so heating it in the microwave is easy and i dont feel the gritty texture.
  1570. I use shea butter in my all vegetable soap. It is very good for your skin.. the service was very fast.. the quality is good.
  1571. I have used raw organic shea butter for years. And I love the way it moisturizes. However, I appreciate the fact that some find the aroma slightly offensive. It doesn't bother me. What did bother me about this shipment, was how it was put together. It looked as if a 1 year old put the shea butter in the container, that was too big for the amount of shea butter. The shea butter was scooped out in such a way, that there are about 200 small chunks sloppily dumped into the plastic container. Not esthetically pleasing. It gives one the impression that the company doesn't really care about the consumer. That may not be the case, but because it was packaged in such an unattractive way, I'm sure I will not order from them again.
  1572. Used this to make DIY deoderant. Works fabulously. I'm going to use it next to make my own foundation and concealer.
  1573. ...which is a good thing, since it comes in a plastic bag and doesn't look too appealing. You will need a jar to put this in; I've decanted it into a smaller jar, put some into a zip-lock bag to share, and squeezed some directly from the bag. The product is initially stiff to work with, but it does dissolve into your skin nicely and protects for a long time. I like the fact that it is unrefined (and it's quite smooth and clean-feeling). I plan to re-order.
  1574. Item met my expectations.
  1575. As far it goes for being 100% pure it isn't. If you use shea butter on a normal bases you can tell the difference when it is applied to a scar. I wouldn't recommend using on a severe burn or sore but its perfect for keeping your skin soft.
  1576. This will last my family all summer long. I'm a long customer of organic raw shea butter. It keeps my skin soft for a very long time.
  1577. Nothing more nothing less.<br /><br />Pros:<br />unified color througout<br />no bad odors<br />pure raw product<br /><br />Cons:<br />None<br /><br />This stupid review thing says I need four more words.... I've got some four letter words for you....
  1578. Good quality. One pound is a lot for a person to use, even if using some for making soap. I had to throw away part of a previous purchase because it became rancid. Now I keep a little on hand as a hand/body moisturizer and store the excess in the refrigerator, hopefully it will last longer.<br />The item comes in a plastic bag, so it would not make an impressive gift without repackaging. For personal use it is great, and one does not have to pay for fancier packaging.
  1579. I didn't open the plastic wrap until today and was overcome by the smell of this product. I did some research on what unrefined organic raw shea butter should smell like and though it is supposed to have a nutty smell and some people don't care for it, this smelled like Crisco gone bad. It says it is organic, but it was not marked organic.<br /><br />I am returning this product.
  1580. My 6 year old son has terrible eczema and has to use a prescription steroid cream when he has his break outs. I have found that natural shea butter helps keep his out breaks away and even helps to get rid of them without the use of his medicine. This works better than any other lotion or cream that I have purchase at the stores. It doesn't have an aromatic smell but its not awful, I'm just grateful for having something natural and non-steroidal to use on him. The packaging did surprise me though, it came in what looks like a plastic Chinese food to go container.
  1581. I love this product.. it makes my skin so soft.. I have really dry skin and this does the job right.. it has sort of a cocoa butter smell which I like.. it comes in a clear sealed bag but I have switched to a plastic container.. and a little goes a long way, so i'll have this pound of shea for a very very long time.. great buy..
  1582. What a disappointment. I know shea butter has a different scent to it but this was not right. Smells like old, left in the hot car lipstick. At some point before getting to me, the product had melted. The plastic food container it was placed in was broken and separated upon arrival. Also, it looked like there had been yellow dye added, unlike what the computer picture appears, product was not cream color but am ugly yellow It really, really frustrates me that I would have to pay shipping to return this foul product. As a consumer, I trust that the companies I purchase from are honest and forthright. This company got my money and therefore stays in business a little while longer while I and others like me are filling our trash cans with their products and have empty wallets. There should be some accountability by businesses and Amazon for the customer. How nice it would be to block companies from my Amazon searches.
  1583. Very creamy and smooth. I melt it down and add it to my homemade deodorant recipe. Highly recommend this for lotions and other homemade goodies.
  1584. Came in a food container and the oils leaked a bit. I got it durning a heat wave. But works great without that over processed Shea scent.
